intro: Hyoseris hispida, commonly known as the rough hairy sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf structures. The plant features rough, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, stiff hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hyoseris hispida is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
